name: Crown Promenade Melbourne

reviews.text: Good location, very modern, immaculate rooms, good views and reasonable value for money.
reviews.title: Nice, modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were offered an upgrade to a suite but even at the discounted rate we didnt feel it was worth the extra money. The standard room is more than adequate.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, fabulous city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved every minute of it. Huge room, full length glass window, complimentary champagne from the manager, massive comfortable bed, very modern room but very luxurious.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — Considering the cost - service could be improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located next to the casino - which we only walked through but it looked quite impressive., also close to the river and all the lovely bars and restaurants
reviews.title: Superb hotel.

likes.liked: — Absolutely everything, however the location was brilliant.
likes.disliked: — Nothing to say, everything was A1.

reviews.text: The pool and gym were great, so relaxing and there was cheap internet access in the cafe at the leisure facilites.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with some practical issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must admit to be guilty of only to finally make some time now to write a review even though I stayed about 4 months ago. I've been extensively using this site to find accomodation for my soon Tassie trip and I just thought I can't just take and not give so here it is.
reviews.title: Met expectations thanks to Tripadvisor

reviews.text: I actually booked directly by ringing the hotel which I found out was cheaper than through Wotif. The great service started from then, staff was very nice and friendly when I made the booking over the phone. Answered all my stupid questions with enthusiam and patience.
reviews.title: Modern & great location!

reviews.text: We arrived quite late the first night and used the valet service and the dude who parked our car wasn't the most friendly and didn't give us one of those tickets that we needed to retrieve our car even though i asked whether i needed something to confirm my parking.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - great value & location
Better than average
reviews.text: Nevertheless when we got into the room we were very impressed. The room was modern and very clean and as the booking girl promised she gave us a room on a high floor with great views. Loved the huge windows which have electric half see through blinds which people can't see us from outside (not that anyone can with us being so high anyway).

The bed was nice and comfy, tv big enough with cable chanels, nice desk and chair and my favourite of all was the awesome big big and very modern bathroom. The bathroom also had a retractable clothes line to hang clothes, and also fold down seat inside the shower! My girlfriend was so impressed.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel along the Yarra River next to Crowne Entertainment Complex & Casino

reviews.text: We stayed in a twin room (3 adults sharing) for 3 nights in early Jan 2008. We booked direct with the hotel and got a great rate just a few days before arriving (cancelling my previous booking from many months earlier).
reviews.title: Loved it!!

likes.disliked: — Small mix up over bill upon check out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very light and airy with modern decor. Our room was on the 17th floor and had a great view towards the river and South Bank. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom clean and spacious (loved the double walk in shower cubicle). The room had coffee making facilities and a safe. We used the internet access (fee) and it was fine. We did not use the restaurant but did have a night cap in the bar which was quite pleasant. The concierge was very helpful when we asked for advice on a particular trip.
reviews.title: A nice hotel but not outstanding

reviews.text: The pool and gym facilities were excellent and there was a coffee/juice bar next to them (with several PCs for internet access) as well as a small outdoor sun terrace.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was just a couple of minutes walk to the shops and restaurants on South Bank or a pleasant 10 min walk into Melbourne CBD. The tram to St Kilda stopped a short walk away. Crown Promenade was connected by a walkway to the huge Crown Towers hotel and casino next door if it was too hot to go outside.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue we had was when checking out. The bill came to more than I was expecting and when we looked closely we had been charged more for the Sat/Sun night than Fri. The receptionist told us that was standard hotel policy and disagreed with me when I said that on our reservation the 3 nights were for the same price. Luckily I had my email confirmation with me and aksed to speak to her supervisor. Since I had the price in writing the hotel honoured this but without a word of apology at having almost over charged us. So, word of caution: check your bill carefully upon checking out.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel - Good Location
Comfy Beds, Stylish Rooms, and Great Views
reviews.text: What else can I say? The nicest (and largest) standard hotel room I have stayed in in Australia, with the most comfy bed. Great location only 5 minutes walk through the casino to the tram stop. Room 1776 had great views across the city to the water - gorgeous! Would never stay anywhere else in Melbourne.

I stayed here for 4 nights on my own, I actually booked 5 nights as I had an early arrival from UK, the hotel gave me an excellent deal on the additional night. The rooms are very comfortable, lovely view (albeit across 2 freeways which seem to be everywhere in Melbourne) towards Port Phillip Bay.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Amazing hotel
reviews.text: I picked this location as I was on my own, the choice of restaurants around this area was fabulous so I did not have to venture out into the city of an evening on my own. Plus the casino was great for an early evening drink - always full of people playing the 'pokies' - slot machines to us!
I had a room service snack on one evening and it was fine - excellent steak in the sandwich, which is unusual. Staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Make the perfect weekend getaway
Crown the King
reviews.text: I won't be staying again, unfortunately, as Australia is too far away for another visit - but it was great to see again after 38 years! Melbourne is unbelievable now, so huge and the river Yarra area very well developed - plus I was there for the Chinese New Year, so entertainment was everywhere in the streets. All in all, a great stay.

description: Relaxed, award-winning and thoroughly modern, Melbourne's Crown Promenade offers you a fresh perspective on how good a hotel can be. Located in the heart of the action - Melbourne's vibrant Southbank entertainment precinct and directly linked to the exciting Crown Entertainment Complex, Crown Promenade is also close to the CBD, the Melbourne Exhibition Centre and the city's most famous arts and sporting facilities. Eat and drink in style at Mesh restaurant or Tonic Bar, relax by the pool or take a walk to the 24 hour action of Melbourne's Crown Entertainment Complex. Sleep, eat, work or play - you can do it all in style at Crown Promenade.- Winner for ‘Deluxe Accommodation’ in the 2009 Qantas Australian Tourism Awards- Winner of the ‘Superior Accommodation Hotel of the Year’, in the 2009 Australian Hotels Association (AHA) Awards Victoria
